We believe we met all the requirements set forth by the Treasury to apply for the loans and did so in good faith, ensuring continued employment for our employees during a period of widespread economic uncertainty, which continues today.

For reference, these loans can be forgiven by the small business administration if borrowers can demonstrate that they use the funds on eligible expenses, such as meeting payroll, rent, mortgage interest and utility obligations over a 24 week period. As of July, we used 100% of the loan proceeds on these eligible expenses. We are planning to submit our forgiveness application to our lender and the SBA in Q3.

The U.S. Treasury previously announced that all borrowers that received PPP loans in excess of $2 million will be audited. However, the time line for the audit is unclear at this time. To the extent the PPP loans are not forgiven, the company is required to pay the loans over a two year period at a 1% interest rate.
